interrogation_impact: 8 founder-confirmed fields replaced AI guesses. Stage, headcount, funding, tech_stack, active_users, WTP, social presence, and founded_date now high-confidence. Remaining gaps are all market-facing (require real users to fill).

items.title: Clear, differentiated market position
items.detail: No direct competitor combines stage diagnosis + interrogation + weekly experiment loops at $20-200/mo. 7 competitors profiled, none match this specific bundle.
items.evidence: Market intelligence scan of 7 competitors; Reddit frustration themes validate the gap

items.title: Problem urgency is real (hair-on-fire)
items.detail: Target founders have acute pain around growth strategy. Founder himself is patient zero — building the tool because he couldn't find it.
items.evidence: Reddit sentiment analysis + founder confirmation: 'I do not know growth. That is why I am building it'

items.title: Brand voice and persona are defined
items.detail: Veteran Operator archetype, Alex the Builder persona, 4 value prop pillars, anti-persona defined.

items.title: ICP and pain points are sharp
items.detail: Primary ICP defined with high confidence. Pain points mapped from website and founder's own experience.
items.evidence: Company Seed fields confirmed by founder

items.title: Production-grade tech stack
items.detail: Next.js 16, React 19, MongoDB/Mongoose 8, Inngest, Vercel AI SDK, Stripe, PropelAuth — this isn't a prototype, it's a real product with auth, payments, and event-driven architecture already wired.

items.title: Founder-problem fit is genuine
items.detail: Tom is building the exact tool he needs. He doesn't know growth, went in circles, and is now systematising the solution. This is the strongest type of founder motivation.
items.evidence: Founder interrogation: 'I keep going in circles. I haven't spoken to users properly yet, I do not know growth. That is why I am building it'

working.summary: Strong foundations: real problem, genuine founder-problem fit, sharp ICP, production-grade product, and clear market gap. The company profile is now 68% confident with founder-verified data. What's missing is entirely market-facing — you need humans using this thing.

items.title: Zero users — product is live but nobody's in it
items.detail: Product is deployed, auth and payments wired, but zero active users. You've been building, not selling.
items.action_to_resolve: Stop building features. Spend the next 2 weeks doing ONLY user outreach. 10 founders using the product is the goal.

items.title: No user conversations — biggest risk
items.detail: Founder confirmed: 'I haven't spoken to users properly yet.' This is the #1 risk. You're building in a vacuum. Every assumption about ICP, pain points, and aha moment is unvalidated.
items.action_to_resolve: Schedule 5 user interviews this week. Reddit DMs, Indie Hackers, founder Slack groups. 15 minutes each. Ask: what's your biggest growth challenge right now?

items.title: Willingness to pay — zero signal
items.detail: Stripe is wired but nobody has hit it. Pricing exists on the site but it's theoretical.
items.action_to_resolve: After getting 5 free users through the product, offer the 6th a paid plan. Even $10/mo. One transaction validates the model.

items.title: Reddit prospecting but no systematic acquisition
items.detail: Active on Reddit looking for customers, but no tracking, no funnel, no conversion data.
items.action_to_resolve: Create a simple tracking sheet: Reddit post/comment → DM → signup → activated → retained. Measure your conversion at each step.

items.title: Evenings and weekends only
items.detail: Solo founder with a full-time job. ~10-15 hrs/week available. This constraint means every hour must count — no more building features, only validation activities.
items.action_to_resolve: Ruthless prioritisation. The ONLY things that matter in the next 2 weeks: user conversations, watching people use the product, and collecting feedback.

items.title: Going in circles — no feedback loop
items.detail: Founder admitted to going in circles. The fix is external signal. Users break the loop because they tell you what matters vs what you think matters.
items.action_to_resolve: Each week, write down your top assumption. Design one action to test it. Do it. Record the result. This IS the GrowthMind methodology — use it on yourself.

items.title: Dormant social presence
items.detail: LinkedIn and Twitter exist but unused. For a growth tool, this is a trust gap. Founders will Google you before signing up.
items.action_to_resolve: Pick ONE channel. Post 2x/week about what you're learning from building a growth tool. Build in public = free marketing + credibility.

needs_work.summary: The pattern is clear: you've over-indexed on building and under-indexed on talking to people. Product is real, but every market-facing metric is zero. The circles you're going in will only break when you get external signal from actual humans using the product.

items.title: 5 user interviews in the next 7 days
items.detail: DM founders on Reddit (r/startups, r/SaaS, r/EntrepreneurRideAlong), Indie Hackers, or founder Slack groups. Message: 'I'm building a growth tool for pre-PMF founders — can I get 15 min of your time to understand your biggest growth challenge?' You're not selling. You're listening.
items.unlocks: Problem validation, ICP refinement, language-market fit, feature priorities from real humans.
items.bandwidth_note: 2-3 evenings of DMs + calls. Fits your schedule.

items.title: Get 5 founders INTO the product
items.detail: From those conversations (or separate outreach), get 5 people to actually sign up and go through the growth diagnosis flow. Watch at least 2 of them do it live (screen share). You need to see where they get stuck, confused, or delighted.
items.unlocks: Activation rate, aha moment validation, UX friction points, first qualitative feedback.
items.bandwidth_note: Offer free access. Make it easy. 'Hey I'll walk you through it in 10 min' works.

items.title: Track everything in a simple spreadsheet
items.detail: Columns: Name, Source, Date contacted, Signed up (Y/N), Reached diagnosis (Y/N), Came back (Y/N), Feedback. No fancy analytics needed yet — just a Google Sheet.
items.unlocks: Conversion funnel visibility, pattern recognition across users.

items.title: Use GrowthMind on yourself
items.detail: You're building a growth tool and you're pre-PMF. Dog-food it. Run your own startup through the diagnosis flow. If it gives you useful advice, that's validation. If it doesn't, that's a bug to fix before showing anyone else.
items.unlocks: Product quality check, content of first case study, founder story for marketing.

items.title: Start building in public (1 channel, 2x/week)
items.detail: Pick Twitter or LinkedIn. Share: what you're learning, mistakes you're making, insights from user interviews. This builds credibility AND is your acquisition channel.
items.unlocks: Social presence, organic discovery, founder credibility, content for future marketing.

next_steps.summary: Your next 2 weeks in 3 words: TALK TO PEOPLE. You have ~10-15 hrs/week. Spend 80% on conversations and watching people use the product, 20% on fixing what you learn. Zero hours on new features. The circles stop when external signal starts.
